description: The bank marketing dataset is related to direct marketing campaigns of a Portuguese banking institution. The marketing campaigns were based on phone calls to convince clients to subscribe to a bank term deposit. Often, more than one contact to the same client was required. The dataset includes client demographic data, campaign information, and socio-economic indicators.
creator: Paulo Cortez, Sérgio Moro

feature_names.day: Last contact day of the month
feature_names.campaign: Number of contacts during this campaign
feature_names.pdays: Days since last contact from previous campaign
feature_names.previous: Number of contacts before this campaign

feature_descriptions.day: Last contact day of the month (numeric: 1-31)
feature_descriptions.duration: Last contact duration in seconds (numeric). Important note: this attribute highly affects the output target
feature_descriptions.campaign: Number of contacts performed during this campaign and for this client (includes last contact)
feature_descriptions.pdays: Number of days that passed by after the client was last contacted from a previous campaign (-1 means client was not previously contacted)
feature_descriptions.previous: Number of contacts performed before this campaign and for this client
feature_descriptions.poutcome: Outcome of the previous marketing campaign (categorical: 'failure', 'other', 'success', 'unknown')

target_values.yes: Client subscribed to a term deposit
target_values.no: Client did not subscribe to a term deposit

use_case: Predicting whether a client will subscribe to a term deposit based on direct marketing campaign data. Useful for optimizing marketing strategies, resource allocation, and improving campaign effectiveness.
ethical_considerations: The dataset contains personal demographic information and should be used responsibly. Care should be taken to avoid discriminatory practices based on age, marital status, or education level. The 'duration' feature should be excluded for realistic predictive models as it's only known after the call.

citations.author: S. Moro, R. Laureano and P. Cortez
citations.title: Using Data Mining for Bank Direct Marketing: An Application of the CRISP-DM Methodology
citations.venue: Proceedings of the European Simulation and Modelling Conference - ESM'2011

additional_notes.duration_warning: The 'duration' attribute highly affects the output target (if duration=0 then y='no'). This input should only be included for benchmark purposes and should be discarded for realistic predictive models.
additional_notes.campaign_period: Data collected from May 2008 to November 2010

original_source.creator: Paulo Cortez, Sérgio Moro
original_source.publication: S. Moro, R. Laureano and P. Cortez: Using Data Mining for Bank Direct Marketing: An Application of the CRISP-DM Methodology

columns.semantic_description: Last contact duration in seconds (numeric). Important note: this attribute highly affects the output target

columns.semantic_description: Number of contacts performed during this campaign and for this client (includes last contact)

columns.semantic_description: Number of days that passed by after the client was last contacted from a previous campaign (-1 means client was not previously contacted)

columns.name: Number of contacts before this campaign
columns.semantic_description: Number of contacts performed before this campaign and for this client

columns.name: Outcome of previous marketing campaign
columns.semantic_description: Outcome of the previous marketing campaign (categorical: 'failure', 'other', 'success', 'unknown')

target_classes.name: yes

target_classes.name: no
